title: Johnny Austin
text:
Johnny Austin (23 December 1910 – 14 February 1983) was a musician born in <a href="Vineland%2C%20New%20Jersey">Vineland, New Jersey</a>. His name was originally John A. Augustine.
He played <a href="trumpet">trumpet</a> with the <a href="Glenn%20Miller%20Orchestra">Glenn Miller Orchestra</a>, parting ways with that band in 1939. He formed the Johnny Austin Orchestra in 1947. The Austin Band was never recorded. Johnny's playing can be heard on recordings of <a href="Jan%20Savitt">Jan Savitt</a>.
A 45 by Blu-"J" records, Blue-"J" 239, the label of which identifies their address as "5th Avenue, New York", Blu-"J" 239, has the following sides:
a- "My Heart is Just a Toy" (Orlando Bros - Tacconelli), Johnny Austin Orchestra, vocal Lois Martin
b - "Flea Hop" (Johnny Austin) - Johnny Austin Orchestra
